metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（四道桥超级站大孔径闪烁仪-2019）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the large aperture scintillometer (LAS) at Sidaoqiao Superstation in the Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1 to December 31 in 2019. There were BLS900, BLS450 and RR-RSS460 at Sidaoqiao Superstation. The north towers were set up with these instruments’ receivers and the south towers were transmitters. The site (north: 101.137° E, 42.008° N; south: 101.131° E, 41.987 N) was located in Ejinaqi, Inner Mongolia. The underlying surfaces between the two towers were tamarisk, populus, bare land and farmland. The elevation is 873 m. The effective height of the LAS was 25.5 m, and the path length was 2350 m. The data were sampled 1 minute.
The raw data acquired at 1 min intervals were processed and quality controlled. The data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods, in which sensible heat flux was iteratively calculated by combining Cn2 with meteorological data according to the Monin-Obukhov similarity theory. The main quality control steps were as follows: (1) The data were rejected when Cn2 exceeded the saturated criterion (BLS900&BLS450：Cn2>7.25E-14，RR-RSS460：Cn2>7.84 E-14). (2) The data were rejected when the demodulation signal was small (BLS900&BLS450：Average X Intensity<1000；RR-RSS460：Demod>-20mv). (3) The data were rejected when collected during precipitation. (4) The data were rejected if collected at night when weak turbulence occurred (u* was less than 0.1 m/s). In the iteration process, the universal functions of Thiermann and Grassl (1992) and Andreas (1988) were selected for BLS900 and RR-RSS460, respectively. Detailed can refer to Liu et al. (2011, 2013). Due to instrument adjustment and inadequate power supply, the date of missing data for the large aperture scintillator is: 2019.04.14-2019.04.25；2019.11.02-2019.11.12。
Several instructions were included with the released data. (1) The las data are firstly from BLS900, followed by BLS450, and finally the final missing data was marked with-6999. (2) The dataset contained the following variables: Date/time (yyyy/m/d h:mm), the structural parameter of the air refractive index (Cn2, m-2/3), and the sensible heat flux (H, W/m^2). In this dataset, a time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30, and the data were stored in *.xlsx format. 
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游四道桥站的大孔径闪烁仪通量观测数据。下游四道桥站分别架设了BLS450、BLS900和RR-RSS460型号的大孔径闪烁仪，北塔为接收端，南塔为发射端。观测时间为2019年1月1日至2019年12月31日。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗，下垫面是柽柳、胡杨、裸地和耕地。北塔的经纬度是101.137E，42.008N，南塔的经纬度是101.131E，41.987N，海拔高度约873m。大孔径闪烁仪的有效高度25.5m，光径长度是2350m，采样频率是1min。
大孔径闪烁仪原始观测数据为1min，发布的数据为经过处理与质量控制后的数据，其中感热通量主要是结合自动气象站观测数据，基于莫宁-奥布霍夫相似理论通过迭代计算得到，主要的质量控制步骤包括：（1）剔除Cn2达到饱和的数据（BLS900&BLS450：Cn2>7.25E-14，RR-RSS460：Cn2>7.84 E-14）；（2）剔除解调信号强度较弱的数据（BLS900&BLS450：Average X Intensity<1000；RR-RSS460：Demod>-20mv）；（3）剔除降水时刻的数据；（4）剔除稳定条件下的弱湍流的数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。在迭代计算过程中，对于BLS900&BLS450，选取Thiermann and Grassl(1992)的稳定度普适函数；对于RR-RSS460，选取Andreas(1988)的稳定度普适函数，详细介绍请参考Liu et al. (2011, 2013)。由于仪器故障，大孔径闪烁仪数据缺失的日期为：2019.04.14-2019.04.25；2019.11.02-2019.11.12。
关于发布数据的几点说明：（1）下游LAS数据以BLS900为主，其次为BLS450，最后为RR-RSS460，最终缺失时刻以-6999标记。（2）数据表头：Date/Time ：日期/时间（格式：yyyy/m/d h:mm），Cn2 ：空气折射指数结构参数（单位：m-2/3），H：感热通量（单位：W/m2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xlsx格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.

methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经历了几次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，从而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型和相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作），以及2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量重点关注降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS，以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）进行测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）由GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区面临的挑战包括寒冷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了数据收集。为了解决这个问题，建立了一个综合观测网络，配备自动气象站和超级站，以进行雪盖和冻土观测，确保全面的数据覆盖。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在所述领域中，确保使用大孔径闪烁仪收集的数据准确性和可靠性所采用的具体方法是什么？

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在偏远地区收集和处理高山水文数据的主要挑战是什么，以及这些挑战是如何应对的？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'large aperture scintillometer' in data collection for evapotranspiration studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: “大孔径闪烁仪”在蒸散研究的数据收集中有什么重要意义？
Definition.AnswerEn: The large aperture scintillometer is significant in data collection for evapotranspiration studies as it measures fluxes such as sensible heat, which are crucial for understanding surface processes. It uses the principle of scintillation to detect changes in the refractive index of air, allowing for the estimation of heat and mass transfer over large distances, which is essential for evaluating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 大孔径闪烁仪在蒸散发研究的数据收集中具有重要意义，因为它测量诸如显热等通量，这对于理解表面过程至关重要。它利用闪烁原理检测空气折射率的变化，从而估算大距离上的热量和物质传输，这对于评估异质景观中的蒸散发至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the typical challenges faced in collecting high-quality hydrometeorological data in alpine regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集高质量水文气象数据的典型挑战是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting high-quality hydrometeorological data in alpine regions include harsh climate conditions, high altitude, and complex topography that hinder consistent data collection. These challenges affect the development of remote sensing technologies and hydrological models, making it difficult to obtain accurate observations necessary for understanding and modeling alpine hydrological processes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集高质量水文气象数据的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素妨碍了数据的持续收集。这些挑战影响了遥感技术和水文模型的发展，使得获得准确的观测数据变得困难，而这些数据对于理解和模拟高山水文过程是必不可少的。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when collecting data in alpine regions compared to arid or semi-arid regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在收集阿尔卑斯地区与干旱或半干旱地区的数据时面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The challenges in alpine regions primarily involve the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, complex topography, and scarcity of observation data due to access difficulties and technological barriers. In contrast, arid or semi-arid regions face ecological environment degradation issues, such as drying rivers and lakes, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. Both regions face unique environmental challenges that impact data collection but differ in their climatic and ecological contexts.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的挑战主要涉及寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔、复杂的地形以及由于获取困难和技术障碍导致的观测数据稀缺。相比之下，干旱或半干旱地区面临生态环境退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这两个地区面临独特的环境挑战，影响数据收集，但在气候和生态背景上有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying methodologies might be used to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data collected from remote alpine regions, given the technological barriers and harsh climate?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 为了确保从偏远高山地区收集的数据的准确性和可靠性，可以采用哪些基础方法，考虑到技术障碍和恶劣气候？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network using automatic meteorological stations and superstations can be employed to capture comprehensive data, including snow accumulation and ablation processes, soil physics, and meteorological factors. This approach addresses the challenges of data scarcity by providing gap-free datasets and validating remote sensing products.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度观测网络，利用自动气象站和超级站，可以捕捉全面的数据，包括雪积累和融化过程、土壤物理特性以及气象因素。这种方法通过提供无缝的数据集和验证遥感产品，解决了数据稀缺的问题。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why are errors in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures significant for the performance of the TSEB model in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，土壤和冠层组分温度估计误差对TSEB模型性能的重要性是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures can significantly impact the TSEB model performance because these temperatures influence the calculation of surface–air temperature differences, which are crucial for accurate energy balance estimations. Overestimation of component temperatures can lead to inaccuracies in latent and sensible heat flux calculations, especially in strongly advective environments where such discrepancies can be exacerbated.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组分温度估计中的错误会显著影响TSEB模型的性能，因为这些温度会影响表面与空气温度差的计算，而这对于准确的能量平衡估算至关重要。组分温度的高估可能导致潜热和显热通量计算的不准确，特别是在强烈的平流环境中，这种差异可能会被加剧。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What challenges arise from the complex topography and climate of oasis–desert systems that impact long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统复杂的地形和气候带来了哪些挑战，这些挑战影响了能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The complex topography and harsh climate of oasis–desert systems create challenges for long-term observations by causing difficulties in maintaining consistent data collection. This affects the ability to accurately measure and model energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, as the environment can lead to equipment malfunctions and data gaps, complicating efforts to understand and manage the oasis–desert interactions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的复杂地形和恶劣气候给长期观测带来了挑战，因为这会导致数据收集的一致性受到影响。这影响了准确测量和建模能量、水蒸气和碳交换的能力，因为环境可能导致设备故障和数据缺失，复杂化了理解和管理绿洲-沙漠相互作用的工作。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the integration of multiscale observation networks affect the understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测网络的整合将如何影响对高山地区水文过程的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale observation networks can enhance the understanding of hydrological processes by providing comprehensive datasets that capture meteorological, snow, and frozen ground data across basin and sub-basin scales. This approach can improve hydrological models, validate remote sensing data, and offer insights into the impacts of climate change and human activities on alpine hydrology.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多尺度观测网络可以通过提供涵盖流域和子流域尺度的气象、雪和冻土数据的综合数据集，增强对水文过程的理解。这种方法可以改善水文模型，验证遥感数据，并提供关于气候变化和人类活动对高山水文影响的见解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to collect long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Collecting such data is crucial for understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems, maintaining ecological stability, supporting socioeconomic development, and achieving carbon neutrality goals. Long-term observations help in recognizing key characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which are significant for sustainable oasis development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 收集这些数据对于理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用、维护生态稳定、支持社会经济发展以及实现碳中和目标至关重要。长期观察有助于识别能量、水汽和碳交换的关键特征，这对可持续的绿洲发展具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network be established to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何建立一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，以捕捉高山地区的雪积累和融化过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Establish an observation network with automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground. Use remote sensing data for validation, and instruments like GammaMONitor for snow water equivalent and FlowCapt for blowing snow. Monitor meteorological variables, soil temperature, and moisture at multiple layers, and use eddy covariance systems for evapotranspiration observation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 建立一个观察网络，配备自动气象站和用于雪和冻土的超级站。利用遥感数据进行验证，并使用GammaMONitor仪器测量雪水当量，使用FlowCapt监测吹雪。监测多个层次的气象变量、土壤温度和湿度，并使用涡度协方差系统观察蒸散发。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the accurate measurement and monitoring of soil and canopy component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在异质景观中准确测量和监测土壤及树冠组件温度成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal cameras and the integration of ground-based measurement data, such as those from a boundary layer tower, allow for the accurate measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures. These advancements enable the application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to estimate evapotranspiration components more accurately.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用以及地面测量数据的整合，例如来自边界层塔的数据，使得土壤和冠层成分温度的准确测量成为可能。这些进展使得两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型能够更准确地估算蒸散发成分。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of remote sensing data and data assimilation techniques improve the prediction and modeling of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感数据与数据同化技术的结合如何改善高山地区水文过程的预测和建模？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data combined with data assimilation techniques help improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data and validating remote sensing products. This integration is crucial in alpine regions where the scarcity of observation data due to harsh conditions hinders modeling efforts.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与数据同化技术的结合有助于通过提供准确的强迫数据和验证遥感产品来改善水文过程的预测。这种整合在高山地区尤为重要，因为恶劣条件下观测数据的稀缺限制了建模工作。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might datasets from oasis-desert systems be important for understanding carbon exchange, and what expectations might researchers have regarding the impact of these datasets?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集对于理解碳交换很重要，研究人员可能对这些数据集的影响有何期待？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis-desert systems are crucial for understanding carbon exchange because these areas can act as carbon sinks, significantly affecting the carbon balance in arid regions. Researchers might expect that long-term datasets from these systems will provide insights into the interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, which are important for achieving carbon peaking and neutrality goals. Such datasets can also support ecological stability and socioeconomic development by informing sustainable oasis management strategies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集对于理解碳交换至关重要，因为这些地区可以作为碳汇，显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡。研究人员可能会期望这些系统的长期数据集能够提供关于能量、水蒸气和碳通量之间相互作用的见解，这对于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标非常重要。这些数据集还可以通过为可持续绿洲管理策略提供信息，支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your perspective on the challenges faced in the data collection of hydrometeorological variables in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对高山地区水文气象变量数据收集面临的挑战的看法是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Collecting hydrometeorological data in alpine regions presents significant challenges due to harsh climate conditions, high altitude, and complex topography. These factors inhibit consistent data collection and hinder the development and validation of remote sensing technologies and models. An integrated, distributed observation network is necessary to overcome these challenges and ensure comprehensive data for hydrological modeling and ecosystem understanding.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集水文气象数据面临重大挑战，原因包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形。这些因素阻碍了数据的持续收集，并妨碍了遥感技术和模型的发展与验证。为了克服这些挑战，建立一个综合的分布式观测网络是必要的，以确保为水文建模和生态系统理解提供全面的数据。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the potential for integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations in advancing research on oasis-desert interactions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评估将遥感数据与地面观测相结合在推进绿洲-沙漠相互作用研究中的潜力？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations holds considerable potential for advancing research on oasis-desert interactions. Remote sensing provides spatially extensive data that, when combined with detailed ground-based measurements, can enhance the accuracy and resolution of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux assessments. This integrated approach is crucial for understanding and modeling the complex dynamics of oasis-desert systems, particularly in the context of climate change and human activities.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，对于推进对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的研究具有重要潜力。遥感提供了空间广泛的数据，当与详细的地面测量相结合时，可以提高能量、水汽和碳通量评估的准确性和分辨率。这种综合方法对于理解和建模绿洲-沙漠系统的复杂动态至关重要，特别是在气候变化和人类活动的背景下。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how data from large aperture scintillometers can be processed to ensure quality and accuracy in flux measurement.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何处理大孔径闪烁仪的数据，以确保通量测量的质量和准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data from large aperture scintillometers are processed through several quality control steps. These include removing data where the refractive index structure parameter (Cn2) reaches saturation, excluding data with weak demodulation signal strength, eliminating data collected during precipitation, and discarding data under stable conditions with weak turbulence. Iterative calculations based on Monin-Obukhov similarity theory are used, with specific stability functions chosen depending on the model of the scintillometer.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 大型孔径闪烁仪的数据经过几个质量控制步骤处理。这些步骤包括去除当折射率结构参数（Cn2）达到饱和时的数据，排除信号解调强度较弱的数据，消除在降水期间收集的数据，以及丢弃在稳定条件下具有弱湍流的数据。基于莫宁-奥布霍夫相似理论的迭代计算被使用，具体的稳定性函数根据闪烁仪的模型进行选择。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the significance of using an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in alpine hydrology research.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中使用集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络的重要性感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network is significant in alpine hydrology research because it provides comprehensive datasets that capture various hydrometeorological processes. This approach allows for accurate forcing data for alpine hydrological models, enhances the validation of remote sensing products, and improves the understanding of perturbations caused by climate change and human activities. The network involves automatic meteorological stations and superstations that collect diverse data, such as snow cover properties and soil physics, which are crucial for understanding complex alpine processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度观测网络在高山水文学研究中具有重要意义，因为它提供了全面的数据集，捕捉各种气象水文过程。这种方法为高山水文模型提供了准确的强迫数据，增强了遥感产品的验证，并改善了对气候变化和人类活动引起的扰动的理解。该网络包括自动气象站和超级站，收集多样的数据，如雪盖特性和土壤物理特性，这些对于理解复杂的高山过程至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand the challenges of collecting consistent hydrometeorological data in the alpine region.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不理解在高山地区收集一致的水文气象数据所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Collecting consistent hydrometeorological data in the alpine region faces challenges due to the harsh and cold climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which make data collection difficult. These factors hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. Additionally, the availability of forcing data is limited, with only a few weather stations providing necessary information, and high-quality snow and frozen ground data are scarce, complicating parameterization efforts.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集一致的水文气象数据面临挑战，原因在于恶劣寒冷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素使得数据收集变得困难。这些因素阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。此外，强迫数据的可用性有限，只有少数气象站提供必要的信息，而高质量的雪和冻土数据稀缺，进一步复杂化了参数化工作。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data collection methods used to capture hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data in alpine regions, including any challenges encountered in remote and harsh environments.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述用于捕捉高山地区水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据的数据收集方法，包括在偏远和恶劣环境中遇到的任何挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine regions often involves an integrated observation network consisting of automatic meteorological stations, which monitor gap-free meteorological and hydrological data. Snow cover properties are collected from superstations using advanced techniques and instruments. Due to the cold climate, high altitude, and complex terrain, consistent data collection can be challenging, leading to gaps in data that hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集通常涉及一个综合观测网络，该网络由自动气象站组成，监测无间断的气象和水文数据。雪盖特性通过超级站使用先进的技术和仪器进行收集。由于寒冷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，一致的数据收集可能面临挑战，导致数据缺口，这妨碍了遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the data processing and quality control procedures typically applied to long-term flux datasets collected from oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述通常应用于从绿洲-沙漠生态系统收集的长期通量数据集的数据处理和质量控制程序。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control for long-term flux datasets from oasis-desert systems involve several stages: data collection, processing, and archiving. Specifically, half-hourly turbulent flux data are gathered using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, while hydrometeorological data are obtained from automatic weather stations. The dataset includes energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, and supplementary data on vegetation and soil parameters, ensuring comprehensive quality control.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期通量数据集的数据处理和质量控制涉及多个阶段：数据收集、处理和归档。具体而言，使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集半小时的湍流通量数据，同时从自动气象站获取水文气象数据。该数据集包括能量、水蒸气、碳通量以及关于植被和土壤参数的补充数据，确保全面的质量控制。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please detail the methods employed to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration using ground-based measurements, and discuss any associated challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请详细说明使用地面测量将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾的方法，并讨论相关的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Evapotranspiration is partitioned into evaporation and transpiration using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, which are inputs to the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. Challenges include accurately separating composite temperatures in arid regions, where errors can arise from image classification and strong advective conditions. The use of high-resolution thermal cameras and stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes helps improve estimation accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 蒸散发通过地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度进行分割，这些温度是双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的输入。在干旱地区，准确分离复合温度面临挑战，图像分类和强烈的平流条件可能导致误差。使用高分辨率热成像相机以及稳定的氧和氢同位素有助于提高估计的准确性。
